commitResults.messageBody:
Following the instructions for Week 3, Level-1 of Mong can echo commands
sent to the command line. Mong will exit the program when the user types
the command "bye".

Following the instructions for Week 3, Level-2 of Mong allows users to
add items into a list, which can be printed in index order when the
"list" command is entered.

Add items to the list: add items from the command line into a list that
displays when the command "list" is typed out.

Index items in the list: items in the list start from the number "1".

Following the instructions for Week 3, Level-3 of Mong introduces a
marking command for users to set items in the command list as completed
or uncompleted.

Create a class of ListItem: use a class to implement the adding,
indexing, marking, and unmarking of each item in the list.

The class will handle the instantiation of each ListItem and setting of
the "isCompleted" variable that is assigned to each ListItem in the
array of ListItems.

To better align class names with their use cases in the iP, ListItem
class has been refactored to Task.

Level-4 of Mong supports the tracking of three types of data, namely
Todos, Deadlines, and Events. To implement these changes, we use
Inheritance and Polymorphism.

Enumerators for TaskType: we decipher the first word in the command line
as the TaskType. Currently, Mong supports LIST, BYE, MARK, UNMARK,
EVENT, TODO and DEADLINE as valid task types.

Improve code quality: In line with the Week 4 instructions, we improve
code quality through the use of constants (rather than magic numbers),
and following of coding standards. For example, indentations of switch
statements are in-line and naming standards.

Inheritance and polymorphism: Event, Todo, and Deadlines are child
classes of the Task class. The toString() function takes on a
different form based on the whether the object is a Event, Todo, or
Deadline object.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test using the I/O redirection technique

commitResults.messageBody:
Level-5 of Mong is able to handle errors involving the adding, marking,
unmarking, listing, and other basic command errors.

Exceptions will print out the specific error in the terminal.
MongException represents errors specific to Mong such as wrong
task types and erroneous task formats  .

Put all classes into 'mong' package.
Organize related classes into either 'task' or 'exception' package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test files with the refactoring of code directory

commitResults.messageBody:
The ArrayList class is a resizable-array implementation of the List
interface, providing added functionality of deleting items in the list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for deleting tasks in the list
commitResults.messageBody:
Users will be able to delete tasks by specifying the index of the item
on the list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to use ArrayList rather than Array type
Load .txt file data when Mong starts up
Write new saved data to .txt file when chatbot closes successfully
Create new directory and file for new start up
Update .txt file to save when task list changes
Fix error handling for deleteTask, mark and unmark functions

commitResults.messageBody: The Ui class handles interactions with the users.
The Parser class makes sense of user inputs.

The TaskList class contains the list and list operation (add, delete
task).

The Storage class handles loading tasks from the files and saving tasks
to the file.

The find function allows Mong to search for items that contain a single
keyword. The output is a indexed list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more functionality to find function
commitResults.messageBody: The find function searches for a key phrase in this iteration.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments to public methods
